body:
@himanshurawlani 

0. patience, it's painfully slow to build it natively on RPI 3
1. prepare requirements as described in [TensorFlow's doc](https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_sources#prepare_environment_for_linux)
2. build and install bazel from source, you may wanna prepare paging space and increase the maximum size of the memory allocation pool before build bazel as described in [this doc](https://gist.github.com/EKami/9869ae6347f68c592c5b5cd181a3b205) to .
3. ./configure
4. build it with bazel, note that I can build it successfully without modifying source with the following command

```
bazel build --config opt --local_resources 1024.0,0.5,0.5 \
--copt=-mfpu=neon-vfpv4 \
--copt=-ftree-vectorize \
--copt=-funsafe-math-optimizations \
--copt=-ftree-loop-vectorize \
--copt=-fomit-frame-pointer \
--copt=-DRASPBERRY_PI \
--host_copt=-DRASPBERRY_PI \
//tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
```
